column1: A branchial cleft cyst is a lump that develops in the neck or just below the collarbone.
A branchial cleft cyst may form from fluid drained from a sinus.
- Small pits, lumps, or skin tags at either side of the neck or just below the collarbone - Fluid drainage from a pit on the neck
Surgery is generally indicated to remove a branchial cyst to prevent complications, such as infections.
